column4: hey i've just upgraded to hardy...but the update manager asks me to partial upgrade...should i do that
no any udates availabe though
and the restricted driver manager is missing from the menus
its called Hardware Drivers now
there still is nothing  in common
Gnome or Kubuntu?
It should be in System>Administration
no there isn't ...should i make the partial upgrades that update manager asks?
yes
i hope you are right
Does it give you an error?
can you tell us what that error is?
the first error message that appears is can't guess meta-package

:Your system does not contain a ubuntu-desktop, kubuntu-desktop, xubuntu-desktop or edubuntu-desktop package and it was not possible to detect which version of Ubuntu you are running. Please install one of the packages above first using synaptic or apt-get before proceeding.
is there?
Did something wrong happen when doing the upgrade?
nothing wrong
nothing wrong happened during upgrade
Do you have any of those -desktop metapackages installed?
don't know what should i search in synaptic
prehaps ubuntu-desktop
